data.text:
UAFS Announces $55,000 24-Hour Goal for April 28 Day of Giving

The University of Arkansas – Fort Smith will launch its annual UAFS Day of Giving Thursday, April 28, 2022, with fifteen campus initiatives working toward a combined goal of more than $55,000. The annual one-day crowdfunding campaign is an all-out, all hands-on deck, fundraising blitz aimed at supporting scholarships, student experiences, and academic endeavors that make the UAFS campus vibrant and unique and happens at UAFS.

Read MoreUAFS Announces $55,000 24-Hour Goal for April 28 Day of Giving

Devils Den State Park

Devil’s Den State Park is a gorgeous piece of land in the Ozarks. It’s got the scenic vistas and stunning waterways that Arkansans love so much, and it has trails to lead you through it.

Read MoreDevils Den State Park

Anjenette Fenske named director of Medicare Advantage compliance for Arkansas Blue Cross

Little Rock – Anjenette Fenske has been named director of Medicare Advantage compliance for Arkansas Blue Cross and Blue Shield. In her role, Fenske will work closely with the Medicare operations team and Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS).

Read MoreAnjenette Fenske named director of Medicare Advantage compliance for Arkansas Blue Cross

Local Events for Earth Day

Earth Day is an annual event on April 22 that celebrates the planet Earth and raises public awareness about environmental issues. The day is observed worldwide with rallies, conferences, school projects and other activities. Each year around 1 billion individuals across more than 190 countries take action to raise awareness of the climate crisis and bring about behavioral change to protect the environment. In 2020, Earth Day celebrated its 50th anniversary.

Read MoreLocal Events for Earth Day

Delena Hicks named director of Corporate Compliance for Arkansas Blue Cross

Little Rock – Delena Hicks has been promoted to the position of director of Corporate Compliance for Arkansas Blue Cross and Blue Shield. In her role, Hicks will collaborate with leadership throughout the company to define and implement the company’s compliance strategy.

Read MoreDelena Hicks named director of Corporate Compliance for Arkansas Blue Cross

National Volunteer Week: American Red Cross recognizes the crucial support of its volunteers

Rogers — National Volunteer Week is April 17-23, and the American Red Cross of Missouri and Arkansas honors the work of its volunteers who give their time to help people in need. Across the country, more than 300,000 Red Cross volunteers serve their communities by responding to thousands of disasters; supporting the collection of blood to help patients receive the critical care they need; aiding members of the military and their families; helping communities prepare for emergencies around the globe and much more.

Read MoreNational Volunteer Week: American Red Cross recognizes the crucial support of its volunteers

J.B. Hunt Transport Services Cancer Support Home to Offer Free Clinical Breast Exams

Fayetteville — The Washington Regional J.B. Hunt Transport Services Cancer Support Home, located at 488 E. Longview St. in Fayetteville, will offer free clinical breast exams during a breast health clinic on Tuesday, April 26, from 5:00 p.m. - 7:30 p.m.

Read MoreJ.B. Hunt Transport Services Cancer Support Home to Offer Free Clinical Breast Exams

J.B. Hunt Recognized as a 2022 Best Employer for Diversity by Forbes

Lowell – J.B. Hunt Transport Services Inc. (NASDAQ: JBHT), one of the largest supply chain solutions providers in North America, was recently named a 2022 Best Employer for Diversity by Forbes, marking the second consecutive year the company has received the distinction.

Read MoreJ.B. Hunt Recognized as a 2022 Best Employer for Diversity by Forbes

The Life and Times of a Small-Town Arkansas Girl

It seems every generation, at least the ones I have known members of, look back on their childhoods as simpler, better times. Sure, maybe with some hardships and tragedies along the way, but, by and large, there are fond memories. I am no different.
